TypeSignature.Value: .class nested public auto ansi abstract sealed beforefieldinit VisualStyleElement/ListView/Item extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Provides objects for each state of an item of the list view control. This class cannot be inherited.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each property of the VisualStyleElement.ListView.Item class returns a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> for a different state of a list view item.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement.ListView.Item.Normal%2A> property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementListViewItem1` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#177](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.v_70_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#177](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.v_70_1.vb)]

Docs.summary: Gets a visual style element that represents a disabled list view item.
Docs.value: A that represents a disabled list view item.

remarks.format:
## Remarks You can use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer>.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleRenderer> with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyles.VisualStyleElement> returned by the Disabled property. To run this example, paste it into a Windows Form. Handle the form’s <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event and call the `DrawVisualStyleElementListViewItem4` method from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.Paint> event-handling method, passing `e` as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.PaintEventArgs>.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#180](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/p-system.windows.forms.v_32_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.VisualStyleElementsExamples#180](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/p-system.windows.forms.v_32_1.vb)]
